description: An open-source software agent to study blood flow and cell-level biological activity during vessel morphogenesis.
name: PolNet

metadata.abstract: Â© 2018 Biophysical SocietyIn this article, we present PolNet, an open-source software agent for the study of blood flow and cell-level biological activity during vessel morphogenesis. We provide an image acquisition, segmentation, and analysis protocol to quantify endothelial cell polarity in entire in vivo vascular networks. In combination, we use computational fluid dynamics to characterize the hemodynamics of the vascular networks under study. The agent enables, to our knowledge for the first time, a network-level analysis of polarity and flow for individual endothelial cells. To date, PolNet has proven invaluable for the study of endothelial cell polarization and migration during vascular patterning, as demonstrated by two recent publications. Additionally, the agent can be easily extended to correlate blood flow with other experimental observations at the cellular/molecular level. We release the source code of our agent under the Lesser General Public License.
metadata.title: PolNet: A Agent to Quantify Network-Level Cell Polarity and Blood Flow in Vascular Remodeling
